analysis.situation_assessment: Spawn energy crisis: Spawn 6 empty (0/1000), spawns 2-3 critically low. System overly complex with 26 overlapping directives and 4 conflicting behaviors. 174 workers carrying 48.3K energy, sufficient to fill all spawns if routing is optimized.
analysis.reasoning: Simplified directive stack to 1 unified order (from 26). Installed single clean behavior. Increased worker cap to meet 6-spawn scaling law (45 workers/spawn minimum). Raised spawn reserve to 800 to ensure production continuity during harvest cycles. Prioritize spawn saturation before upgrades.
immediate_actions: Monitor spawn 6 recovery (target: 1000 energy within 50 ticks)
Verify spawn_crisis_handler behavior activates if directive fails
Once all spawns ≥900 energy, prepare spawn upgrade sequence (Level 3, sequential start)
analysis.suggestion_evaluation: Spawn level 3 upgrades are strategically sound long-term (1500 energy capacity vs 1000) but premature now. Current spawn 6 is empty; upgrading costs 2500+ energy per spawn. Defer upgrades until: (1) all spawns reach 100% capacity, (2) surplus energy >10K achieved. Then upgrade sequentially, starting with non-critical spawns.
